Key Match Events: Orlando Magic limited New York to just 17 points in the third quarter
Jalen Brunson and Mikal Bridges each scored 24 points, but struggled from three-point range
Cameron Payne hit a meaningless three-pointer with 8.2 seconds left in the game
Pre-Game Insights: Karl-Anthony Towns sat out due to a hamstring injury
The absence of Towns and McBride shouldn't have led to another loss
Cole Anthony scored a team-high 24 points
Post-Match Reflections: The New York Knicks look tired
When Duece McBride is unavailable, Tom Thibodeau's bench moves from thin to utterly hopeless
The Knicks have played their last three games in four days, their past four games in six days, and their last seven in the last eleven days
Miscellaneous Highlights: Orlando ranks tied for 16th in 3-point percentage against (36.0) but leads the NBA in 3-point field goals against (just 11.1 per contest)
The Knicks' shooting struggles from beyond the arc were evident, hitting only 4 of 22 in the game
Others: The New York Knicks are facing a challenging schedule with back-to-back games and a lack of depth in their rotation
